intro: Margelliantha globularis, commonly known as the globe-shaped margelliantha, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its compact, spherical growth form and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep red. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid environment. It blooms during the short growing season in late spring and early summer. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
